content.description: Fun friction climbing where good mantling technique helps. After passing a vary large ledge, use friction and mantling to reach the top anchors.
content.location: Fifth route right of the left corner of Singer Slab. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map 3a & 3b pages 104-105 and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 111.

content.description: Second route from left corner of Singer Slab. Weave past several large huecos using a combination of pockets, ledges, and friction.
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua 2007. maps 3a & 3b pages 104-105.

climbs.name: Gandpa Dave on the Edge
climbs.fa: David Hollings, Alan Kelly, and Mike Heil, 2004.

content.description: Climbs arete located on far left side of Singer Slab. After clipping the third bolt finesse several difficult friction moves up the slab using the arete whenever possible. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua 2007. map 3b page 105.
content.location: Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon, Vol. 2: Umpqua 2007. map 3a and 3b page 104-105.

climbs.name: E-squared = 10c
climbs.fa: David Hollings, Alan Kelly, and Mike Heil 2004.

content.description: A few moves of friction and small edges bring you to a wide ledge and a fun section of laybacks. Above this a difficult set of moves takes you over a bulge for continuously thin friction to the top.
content.location: Third route right of the left corner of Singer Slab. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map 3a & 3b pages 104-105 and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 111.

climbs.name: Davidians without Huecos
climbs.fa: David Goodman, Alan Kelly, and Mike Heil 2002.

content.description: Easier climbing takes you too a crux of small edges and friction below the bulge. The bulge requires a somewhat difficult move with an easier finish to the top.
content.location: Fourth route right of the left corner of Singer Slab. Refer to Rock Climbing Western Oregon Vol. 2: Umpqua map 3a & 3b pages 104-105 and GPS coordinates in UTM's page 111.

content.description: Singer Slab has classic Tyee Sandstone friction slab climbing. Route are approximately 60 to 80 feet in length. Singer Slab is in the shadows of the surrounding rocks and trees therefore requires some annual maintenance at the beginning of each seasons. Brushes are available in the community gear box on the Baseline Trail at the foot of Turtle Rock.
